channel.title: Edit interface details [ 508 ]
channel.description:
I made a command that shows an interface, but I forget how to edit the details on it. [code=java] if (cmd[0].equals("commands")) { p.frames.showInterface(p, 275); }[/code] ^ that's all I got in the code, but I forget how to edit it. Right now it says Tite: "ifquestname" info: "qj1 - 298" Quick and simple I think, and my server has no other commands like this to base off of. Once I get this I'll use this for a base.
Thanks in advance. P.S. I'm on 508

item.title: Edit interface details [ 508 ]
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

Davidi2:

If I was you I wouldn’t switch yet, you may want to wait until I release v10 (trust me, it will be worth the wait)

Yeah I will, but my source is retarded. The combat is messed up.

Read full topic

item.title: Edit interface details [ 508 ]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I don’t know if the original pali even had shops, if it did they were player-by-player (aka everyone has their own shops, people cant buy stock from others) and would be in Player.java
However I’ll probably post my 508 public shop handler with a tutorial soon

Read full topic

item.title: Edit interface details [ 508 ]
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:2, topic:398122”]p.frames.setString(p, “text”, interfaceId, childId);

for you it would be
p.frames.setString(p, “text”, 275, childId);

child id is a number indicating what part of the interface you are setting the string for. it’s a lot of guess-and-check to get it right, unless you have interface information[/quote]
Thank you, I went right to you because you’re are the best at 508.

Offtopic: Do you know where shops are in Palidino76 source?

Read full topic

item.title: Edit interface details [ 508 ]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

p.frames.setString(p, “text”, interfaceId, childId);

for you it would be
p.frames.setString(p, “text”, 275, childId);

child id is a number indicating what part of the interface you are setting the string for. it’s a lot of guess-and-check to get it right, unless you have interface information

Read full topic

I made a command that shows an interface, but I forget how to edit the details on it.

if (cmd[0].equals("commands")) { p.frames.showInterface(p, 275); }

info: “qj1 - 298”
Quick and simple I think, and my server has no other commands like this to base off of. Once I get this I’ll use this for a base.
